intro: Goniolimon tataricum var. tauricum, commonly known as the Tauric goniolimon, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, pale blue or white flowers during the summer months. It is part of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with distinctive floral structures. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
